text: I am trying to figure out where the `<link rel="alternate" ..>` tags are coming from on <https://www.witty.works/en/categories/cultural-diversity/cultural-stereotype> that are not appearing on <https://www.witty.works/de/kategorien/kulturelle-diversit%C3%A4t/abstammung> .. those pages are both generated from the same HubDB tables but are separate pages. From my debugging this seems to be coming via `standard_header_includes` but I am not sure how that variable works and how it is configured. any advice?
ah maybe this "magic" happens because for French we also have a page which has a similar URL to english <https://www.witty.works/fr/categories/diversit%C3%A9-culturelle/anglicisme>

is there any way to disable these alternate URLs as they are wrong (or alternatively fix them). part of the issue is that HubSpot does not natively understand the concept of translatable hubdb entries.
Anyone else seeing an issue with HubL widget container ignoring and reordering modules on your pages?
stab in the dark - is the set a_variable... even a valid statement?  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables>
Yes! This is a known issue reported occasionally with the HubL. Try saving the page layout, refreshing and then reordering again.
I’ve tried all sorts of variable names. No luck.
This just started happening yesterday—to pages that were built a year or more ago? It’d be thousands of pages we’d need to do this to. That’s not going to work as a solution.
Totally agree, can you report it to HS? Usually they will also look into fixing such a bug, happened before to me.
